choices.C: index=www | append [search index = sales] | stats count, sum(revenue) as total_revenue by session_id | table total_revenue session_id
choices.A: index=www status=200 uri=/cart/checkout | append [search index = sales] | stats count, sum(revenue) as total_revenue by session_id | table total_revenue session_id
choices.B: (index=www status=200 uri=/cart/checkout) OR (index=sales) | stats count, sum(revenue) as total_revenue by session_id | table total_revenue session_id
choices.D: (index=www) OR (index=sales) | search (index=www status=200 uri=/cart/checkout) OR (index=sales) | stats count, sum (revenue) as total_revenue by session_id | table total_revenue session_id

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the most efficient search?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is the correct

choices.D: To search the firewall index for web logs that have been denied and are of high severity.
choices.C: To return all the web_log events from the web index that occur two hours before and after all high severity, denied events found in the firewall index.
choices.B: To find all the denied, high severity events in the firewall index, and use those events to further search for lateral movement within the web index.
choices.A: To return all the web_log events from the web index that occur two hours before and after the most recent high severity, denied event found in the firewall index.

discussion.content: A is correct because there is a stats command inside the subsearch

Selected Answer: A
A mentions most recent, and the search has stats latest(_time) in its subsearch

The correct answer is A. The search is intended to return all the web_log events from the web index that occur two hours before and after the most recent high severity, denied event found in the firewall index.
The intended function of this search is to return all the web_log events from the web index that occur two hours before and after the most recent high severity, denied event found in the firewall index. The subsearch within square brackets is searching the firewall index for the most recent high severity, denied event, and using the status command to get the latest time for that event. The eval command is then used to create earliest and latest fields for the web_log search, based on the time of the most recent denied event. The fields command at the end is used to limit the fields returned to earliest and latest.
A, because used stats lastest time
C appear correct to me, as latest has +2 hour. so 2 hours before and after events

comments.content: C is wrong, because stats latest(_time). This means current time, not all time
